alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Letcher (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 11:02AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Harlan and southwestern Letcher Counties through 1130 AM EDT... At 1101 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Defeated Creek, or 11 miles southwest of Whitesburg, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lynch, Linefork, Skyline and Blair around 1105 AM EDT. Flint, Kings Creek, Partridge and Lewis Creek around 1110 AM EDT. Maggard and Oscaloosa around 1115 AM EDT. Day, Dongola, Ice, Whitco and Trailer around 1120 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Whitesburg, Oven Fork, Eolia, Ermine, Colly and Mayking. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
